conclusion: Understand the situation of the empty and filled tank with light refraction.
Apply Snell's Law to relate angles of incidence and refraction with refractive indices.
Use geometry of the empty tank to express angle i in terms of tank dimensions.
Use geometry of the filled tank to express angle r in terms of tank dimensions.
Combine Snell's Law and geometry to form an equation involving n_liquid.
Simplify using trigonometric identities to express sin(i) and sin(r).
Solve for n_liquid using the simplified equation.
